intro: Sisyrinchium palmifolium var. nidulare, commonly known as the clustered blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate blue to violet flowers with prominent yellow centers, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or open habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant landscapes.
